intro: Pedicularis punctata, commonly known as the spotted monkey orchid, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae and is characterized by its striking, spurred flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, where it forms dense colonies. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are upright and branched. The flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
